projects.title: Finance Letter Generator System Migration
projects.subtitle: MAHB Industrial Training
projects.shortDescription: Migrated legacy VB.NET finance letter generator to modern Google Apps Script platform
projects.description: Led the complete migration of a legacy VB.NET finance letter generator system to a modern Google Apps Script platform, serving the Finance Department operations. Developed a full-stack solution with responsive web interface and backend API, implementing Google OAuth authentication and role-based access control.
projects.problem: Finance was stuck using a 10-year-old VB.NET app that only ran on certain computers. Nobody really knew how it worked anymore, and they needed something more modern that people could actually access.
projects.solution: I rebuilt the whole thing from scratch using Google Apps Script. Made it web-based with Google login and different access levels. The tricky part was making the new PDFs look almost identical to the old ones—ended up getting it to 95% visual match.
projects.myRole: Did everything from analyzing the old system to building the new frontend and backend. Set up authentication and wrote about 5000 words of documentation so the next person won't be as lost as I was at the start.
projects.outcome: Finance didn't skip a beat during the switch. Now they can use it from any browser, and there's actual documentation for when things need updating.
achievements: Achieved 95% visual similarity with legacy system through pixel-perfect HTML-to-PDF template optimization
Implemented base64 image embedding and session management
Created 5000+ word technical documentation and 65+ page setup guide
Deployed role-based access control (Admin/Viewer)
responsibilities: Legacy system analysis and migration planning

projects.title: StarDesk ML Complaint Classifier
projects.subtitle: Full-Stack ML Application
projects.shortDescription: Cross-platform desktop application with ML backend for automated complaint processing and categorization
projects.description: Built a production-ready intelligent complaint processing system combining a Python FastAPI ML backend with a cross-platform C# .NET desktop application. The system automatically categorizes customer complaints, extracts key information, and generates concise summaries using transformer-based models, processing airline customer feedback with 95%+ automation rate.
projects.problem: Customer service was spending hours manually reading and categorizing airline complaints. They had thousands of them, and it was eating up time that could've been spent actually fixing issues.
projects.solution: Built a desktop app that does the heavy lifting automatically. Used BERT to classify complaints, T5 to write summaries, and NER to pull out important details. Made the frontend in C# so it could process Excel files directly without needing Office installed.
projects.myRole: Did the full stack—trained the ML models, built the FastAPI backend, and made the desktop app with Avalonia UI. Spent a lot of time on error handling since this was going to production.
projects.outcome: Went from hours of manual work to a few minutes. The whole thing runs as a single 103 MB file on Windows, Linux, or Mac—no install process, just run it.
achievements: Automated 95%+ of manual complaint categorization, reducing processing time from hours to minutes
Built cross-platform desktop app (Windows/Linux/macOS) with zero-installation distribution (103 MB self-contained)
Implemented hierarchical classification with confidence scoring across 2-level taxonomy
Created integrated ML pipeline: BERT classification → T5 summarization → NER entity extraction
Developed robust batch processing with retry logic, atomic writes, and real-time progress tracking
responsibilities: Full-stack development (Python FastAPI backend + C# .NET desktop frontend)
ML model integration (BERT, T5, NER) with Hugging Face Transformers
Cross-platform application architecture using MVVM pattern
Direct Excel file manipulation without Office dependencies (EPPlus)
RESTful API design with async processing and error handling

projects.title: Freshservice Hardware Asset Migration Project
projects.subtitle: MAHB Industrial Training
projects.shortDescription: Migrated 20,923 hardware assets from Google Sheets to production freshservice system
projects.description: Led large-scale migration of 20,923 hardware asset records from Google Sheets to the production Freshservice helpdesk system at MAHB. Managed complete data preparation, cleaning, field mapping, testing, and production deployment to provide IT department with comprehensive asset tracking capabilities.
achievements: Successfully imported all 20,923 hardware asset records into live production system with zero data loss
Cleaned and standardized data (removed trailing spaces, standardized date formats)
Mapped complex data fields between Google Sheets and StarDesk with special character handling
Performed comprehensive testing in development environment before production deployment
Verified data integrity through spot checks ensuring 100% accuracy post-migration
responsibilities: Data preparation and cleaning from Google Sheets source
System field mapping between platforms (Google Sheets → StarDesk)
CSV formatting and validation with proper header requirements
Testing and error resolution in development environment

projects.title: Eraman Survey & Audit System Documentation
projects.subtitle: MAHB Industrial Training
projects.shortDescription: Comprehensive documentation for legacy ASP.NET MVC application
projects.description: Created comprehensive software documentation for legacy ASP.NET MVC 5 application, analyzing complex database schema and system architecture.
achievements: Analyzed 6,841-line database schema and 18 controllers
Documented system architecture, security mechanisms, and API specifications
Provided UI/UX consulting for internal projects

projects.title: Finance Manager Web Application
projects.subtitle: Academic Project
projects.shortDescription: Responsive personal finance web app with full DevOps workflow
projects.description: Built a responsive personal finance web application using Vue.js frontend and PHP Slim Framework backend, with complete ownership of the DevOps workflow including deployment on DigitalOcean and Netlify.
projects.problem: Wanted to prove I could handle a project from start to finish—not just write code, but actually deploy it somewhere people could use it. Needed to show I understood servers, security, all of it.
projects.solution: Built a personal finance tracker using Vue.js and PHP Slim. Added JWT login, real-time transaction tracking, and some analytics charts. Then learned how to deploy the whole thing—frontend on Netlify, backend on DigitalOcean with proper SSL setup.
projects.myRole: Did it all myself. Designed it, built it, configured the servers (Apache, MySQL, SSL certs), and wrote up the deployment process so I could remember how I did it.
projects.outcome: Got a working app that's actually live and secure. Also ended up with decent notes on deployment that other students have found useful.
achievements: Implemented JWT-based authentication
Built real-time transaction management
Created interactive analytics dashboards using Chart.js
Configured secure HTTPS setup using DuckDNS + Certbot
Authored detailed fullstack deployment guide

projects.title: HARDA - Hazard Assessment Road Detection Application
projects.subtitle: Final Year Project (In-Progress)
projects.shortDescription: Image recognition system for road hazard detection and mapping
projects.description: Currently developing a system for final year project that uses image recognition models to identify and classify different types of road hazards from user-submitted images, with geo-location tracking on a map.
projects.problem: Potholes and road damage often don't get reported until someone crashes or complains enough. Cities can't inspect every road constantly, so problems slip through the cracks—literally.
projects.solution: Building an app where people can snap a photo of a pothole or road hazard. The ML model figures out what kind of damage it is and pins it on a map. Idea is to help authorities see where problems are and fix the worst ones first.
projects.myRole: It's my final year project, so I'm doing it solo. Designing the whole system, training the image recognition models, hooking up mapping APIs, and building the interface for people to submit photos.
projects.outcome: Still working on it—proposal's approved and architecture is planned out. Should have a working version by June 2026. Trying to make something that could actually be useful, not just a class project.
achievements: Completed proposal stage
Designed system architecture

projects.title: UTMSport - Sports Court Booking System
projects.subtitle: Academic Project - Mobile App Development

projects.description: Built a cross-platform mobile application for managing sports court bookings at Universiti Teknologi Malaysia (UTM). The system provides role-based access for students, event organizers, and administrators to book, track, and manage sports facility usage through a centralized mobile platform, addressing issues of double bookings and poor coordination.

Built role-based access for students, event organizers, and administrators
Created booking tracking for current, upcoming, and past reservations

Booking system architecture and state management

projects.title: Breathe Easy: Respiratory System Explorer
projects.subtitle: Interactive Educational Web Application
projects.shortDescription: Interactive educational website for learning about the human respiratory system with animations, quizzes, and 3D models
projects.description: Developed an interactive educational web application designed to teach biology students about the human respiratory system. The website features interactive anatomy diagrams, breathing animations and simulations, knowledge quizzes, embedded 3D models, and comprehensive disease information—all built with modern vanilla JavaScript using ES6 modules.
projects.problem: Biology students often struggle to visualize and understand the complex mechanics of the respiratory system through static textbook diagrams. There was a need for an engaging, interactive learning tool that could make respiratory anatomy and physiology more accessible.
projects.solution: Built a comprehensive educational platform with multiple interactive features: clickable anatomy diagrams that display detailed information about each respiratory organ, animated breathing simulations showing the inhalation/exhalation process, embedded 3D Sketchfab models for spatial understanding, and gamified quizzes to test knowledge retention.
projects.myRole: Full-stack developer responsible for the entire application architecture. Designed the modular JavaScript structure with separate classes for navigation, anatomy diagrams, breathing animations, and quiz functionality. Implemented responsive CSS with custom properties and created smooth animations for enhanced user engagement.
projects.outcome: Created a fully functional educational resource that provides an immersive learning experience. The modular codebase makes it easy to extend with additional content, and the responsive design ensures accessibility across all devices.
achievements: Built modular JavaScript architecture with 6+ reusable class modules (Navigation, AnatomyDiagram, BreathingAnimation, BreathingSimulation, Quiz, Utils)
Implemented interactive image map with clickable anatomy regions displaying detailed organ information
Created dynamic breathing simulation with real-time oxygen level tracking and animated visuals
Developed comprehensive quiz system with randomized questions, scoring, and answer review functionality
Integrated 3D Sketchfab models for immersive anatomical exploration
Designed responsive layout with CSS custom properties and smooth scroll navigation
responsibilities: Modular JavaScript architecture design using ES6 classes and modules
Interactive UI/UX implementation with animations and transitions
